member.name: T:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisableDefaultConstructorAttribute
member.summary: To disable using default constructor in structs.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisableDefaultConstructorAttribute.IsError
member.summary: Specifies an action when calling the default constructor in structs. If the value is , it will report a compiling error; otherwise, a warning.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.OnAddingAttribute
member.summary: To mark on the method, it means that the method is used for add elements in this current collection.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.OnDeconstructionAttribute
member.summary: It means the method marked this attribute is only used for deconstruction to s.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ParameterizedObjectAttribute
member.summary: Represents the type is only used for parameterized object. You may regard the type as anonymous inner classes (or structs).

member.name: T:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.PatternAttribute
member.summary: It means the parameter marked this attribute is a regular expression pattern.

summary.para: Marks members which are only used for completing syntax-based contract.

For example, C# will allow users to use 'Collection Initialization' syntax to initialize any collections if the target collection object is confirmed that it has Add method to add new elements. suggests you that you should add on Add method.
